item.title: Neurosurgeon: McCain's Recovery From Brain Surgery Might Take Weeks
item.description: July 17, 2017 - Neurosurgeon Peter Nakaji says that the operation performed on Sen. John McCain to remove a blood clot from his brain gets people home within days, but they still need time to recover.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 17, 2017 - Neurosurgeon Peter Nakaji says that the operation performed on Sen. John McCain to remove a blood clot from his brain gets people home within days, but they still need time to recover. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/17/537748077/neurosurgeon-mccains-recovery-from-brain-surgery-might-take-weeks

item.title: Seeking Online Medical Advice? Google's Top Results Aren't Always On Target
item.description: July 17, 2017 - Google's search results on health issues can be influential, but they can also be unreliable or wrong. The highlighted answer may come from a dubious source while a more credible one is buried below.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 17, 2017 - Google's search results on health issues can be influential, but they can also be unreliable or wrong. The highlighted answer may come from a dubious source while a more credible one is buried below. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/17/537711453/seeking-online-medical-advice-googles-top-results-arent-always-on-target

item.title: Trump Administration Moves To Defund Teen Pregnancy Research Programs
item.description: July 17, 2017 - NPR's Audie Cornish talks to Texas A&M professor Kelly Wilson about the Trump administration's moves to defund teen pregnancy research programs, including the program she leads at Texas A&M.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 17, 2017 - NPR's Audie Cornish talks to Texas A&M professor Kelly Wilson about the Trump administration's moves to defund teen pregnancy research programs, including the program she leads at Texas A&M. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/17/537754569/trump-administration-moves-to-defund-teen-pregnancy-research-programs

item.title: Sen. McCain's Recovery From Blood Clot Surgery Threatens GOP Health Care Vote
item.description: July 17, 2017 - The imperiled Senate health care bill hit an unexpected hurdle over the weekend with a health scare that is keeping GOP Sen. John McCain home in Arizona. Without his vote, the bill cannot pass.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 17, 2017 - The imperiled Senate health care bill hit an unexpected hurdle over the weekend with a health scare that is keeping GOP Sen. John McCain home in Arizona. Without his vote, the bill cannot pass. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/17/537754513/sen-mccains-recovery-from-blood-clot-surgery-threatens-gop-health-care-vote

item.title: In Massachusetts, Proposed Medicaid Cuts Put Kids' Health Care At Risk
item.description: July 17, 2017 - Doctors, consumers and politicians say big federal cuts to Medicaid funding would jeopardize the treatment a lot of kids rely on. The state would either have to make up lost funding or cut benefits.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 17, 2017 - Doctors, consumers and politicians say big federal cuts to Medicaid funding would jeopardize the treatment a lot of kids rely on. The state would either have to make up lost funding or cut benefits. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/17/537695506/in-massachusetts-proposed-medicaid-cuts-put-kids-health-care-at-risk

item.title: More Than Bread: Sourdough As a Window Into The Microbiome
item.description: July 17, 2017 - Home bakers in the U.S., Europe and some other countries have volunteered their sourdough starters to a team of American scientists who want to unravel the microbial secrets of sourdough.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 17, 2017 - Home bakers in the U.S., Europe and some other countries have volunteered their sourdough starters to a team of American scientists who want to unravel the microbial secrets of sourdough. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/07/17/536485684/more-than-bread-sourdough-as-a-window-into-the-microbiome

item.title: Forest Bathing: A Retreat To Nature Can Boost Immunity And Mood
item.description: July 17, 2017 - If hiking is about a destination, forest bathing is about an immersion of the senses into the natural world. It's a wellness trend, and studies suggest several health benefits.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 17, 2017 - If hiking is about a destination, forest bathing is about an immersion of the senses into the natural world. It's a wellness trend, and studies suggest several health benefits. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/17/536676954/forest-bathing-a-retreat-to-nature-can-boost-immunity-and-mood

item.title: Artificial Sweeteners Don't Help People Lose Weight, Review Finds
item.description: July 17, 2017 - It's easy to think that artificial sweeteners are a health win. But a review of research finds that there's no evidence they help people lose weight, and they may be associated with other problems.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 17, 2017 - It's easy to think that artificial sweeteners are a health win. But a review of research finds that there's no evidence they help people lose weight, and they may be associated with other problems. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/17/537262142/artificial-sweeteners-dont-help-people-lose-weight-review-finds

item.title: Doctors Report Removing 27 Contact Lenses From A Woman's Eye
item.description: July 16, 2017 - The patient hadn't complained of irritation. "She was quite shocked," specialist trainee ophthalmologist Rupal Morjaria tells Britain's Optometry Today.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 16, 2017 - The patient hadn't complained of irritation. "She was quite shocked," specialist trainee ophthalmologist Rupal Morjaria tells Britain's Optometry Today. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/07/16/537562692/doctors-report-removing-27-contact-lenses-from-a-womans-eye

item.title: Gonorrhea — AKA The Clap — Is Excellent At Resisting Antibiotics
item.description: July 16, 2017 - The sexually transmitted disease is typically not fatal but can cause a lifetime of suffering. And the go-to drugs are increasingly less effective.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 16, 2017 - The sexually transmitted disease is typically not fatal but can cause a lifetime of suffering. And the go-to drugs are increasingly less effective. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/07/16/536478699/gonorrhea-aka-the-clap-is-excellent-at-resisting-antibiotics

item.title: 'Dirt Is Good': Why Kids Need Exposure To Germs
item.description: July 16, 2017 - Should I use antibacterial soaps? How often should I bathe my child? Those are just some of the questions Jack Gilbert, a microbiome scientist, answers in his new book.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 16, 2017 - Should I use antibacterial soaps? How often should I bathe my child? Those are just some of the questions Jack Gilbert, a microbiome scientist, answers in his new book. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/16/537075018/dirt-is-good-why-kids-need-exposure-to-germs

item.title: Stress And Poverty May Explain High Rates Of Dementia In African-Americans
item.description: July 16, 2017 - New research finds that African-Americans who grow up in harsh environments and have many stressful experiences are much more likely to develop Alzheimer's or some other form of dementia.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 16, 2017 - New research finds that African-Americans who grow up in harsh environments and have many stressful experiences are much more likely to develop Alzheimer's or some other form of dementia. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/16/536935957/stress-and-poverty-may-explain-high-rates-of-dementia-in-african-americans

item.title: Shame, Guilt Pose Significant Hurdles For Those Recovering From Addiction
item.description: July 15, 2017 - For some, recovering from addiction is only half the battle. The other half is getting over the guilt, depression and shame associated with it. NPR's Michel Martin speaks with author Neil Steinberg.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 15, 2017 - For some, recovering from addiction is only half the battle. The other half is getting over the guilt, depression and shame associated with it. NPR's Michel Martin speaks with author Neil Steinberg. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/15/537451534/shame-guilt-pose-significant-hurdles-for-those-recovering-from-addiction

item.title: Amid Health Care Debate, Legislative Group Seeks To Foster Bipartisanship
item.description: July 15, 2017 - More and more lawmakers are seeking ways to build bipartisanship. NPR Host Michel Martin talks with co-chairs of the Problem Solvers Caucus, Congressmen Tom Reed and Josh Gottheimer, about health care.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 15, 2017 - More and more lawmakers are seeking ways to build bipartisanship. item.title: A Terminal Illness Divides Parents And Doctors
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
